normalized: my field of vision opened suddenly.
a dry breeze brushed past my side.
my body felt terribly languid.
my hands and feet felt heavy as i finally stood up .

name: asagi
normalized: （where am i…）
rough ground spread out before me.
dried sandy soil and reddish-brown rocks.
not even a weed grew in the barren earth.
but, the wondrous spectacle somehow felt familiar.

name: asagi
normalized: （where have i seen such a place before…）
i slowly edged forward, like i was dragging my legs.
i had no idea where i was.
but, i also knew that i couldn't just be standing around in this place.
there was a small pile of corpses.
they weren't just human bodies though.
strange-looking physiques mixed with the humans and beasts.
the skulls had signs of being smashed as well as the bones of limbs being snapped and scattered all over the place.
armor and helmets were also on the bodies and they all had countless scratches and cuts.

name: asagi
normalized: （battle remains…, or else, the hell borne's…）
i wonder if the victorious side had piled up the remnants of the defeated army's bodies?
the corpses weren't telling me anything.
i suddenly realized that there was a shadow lurking at the top of the pile of corpses.
it was like a suspicious clump of black haze.
it was muttering something.
i could hear a faint voice brought by the wind.
100 wars unbeaten, and now invincible on the battlefield, without rejoicing--
it was like it was singing to itself something while lamenting.
i've lost many friends, but buried several tens of thousands enemies, without anger--
hence, i do not grieve and i am without hope--
that shadow was sitting motionlessly.
maybe its intention was to stay there for eternity.
he suddenly appeared there.

name: asagi
normalized: --ehh?
he gently approached me at the foot of the corpses.

name: kyousuke
normalized: asagi…
that face, that voice--, i could never forget it.

name: asagi
normalized: kyousuke!

name: kyousuke
normalized: asagi…
but, that's impossible--
yeah, he died a year ago.

name: kyousuke
normalized: asagi…

name: asagi
normalized: it can't be--

name: kyousuke
normalized: asagi…

name: asagi
normalized: it can't be!
this is a dream!
i glanced at the pile of corpses.

name: asagi
normalized: what have you done!
my scream resounded in the empty wasteland.

name: asagi
normalized: answer me!
the shadow at the summit swayed.

name: asagi
normalized: what in the hell is going on!
the black shadow slid down to the bottom of the corpses.
i wasn't able to avoid it.
it drew ever more closer and engulfed my languid body.
it obstructed the light.
i couldn't see anything--, it was a profound, unfathomable darkness.
you… me and you, you and me…
this sadness… your sadness
my sadness…
those dark things invaded my consciousness.
i sensed like something was softly touching my cheek.

name: asagi
normalized: who are…, you?
as i asked that question inside the darkness, a person appeared.

name: asagi
normalized: wha--
the person standing before me was…myself.
but, she was somehow different.
her fingertips were sharply transfigured and the muscles in her legs varied from a human's.
she looked like me, but she wasn't human.

name: asagi
normalized: --are you me?
someone is attempting to fuse you and i
that was the answer that had been muttered by the form that resembled me.

name: asagi
normalized: fuse?
it's very precipitous.
perhaps it's like poison

name: asagi
normalized: …poison?
i don't understand
i wasn't able to comprehend what it was she wanted to say.
you can remove the poison, but you have to take part in someone's risky plan

name: asagi
normalized: wait, what the hell--
i am you…, decide for yourself how to use that
the darkness grew and my thoughts ceased accordingly.
